body.p:
To His Excelency
Thos. E. Bramlit
Gov. of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioner would most respectfully state, that some years since He was indicted in the Whitley circuit court for gaming. at the March Term 1862 He was fined the Twenty dollars and cost of the prosecution --

He would further state that the amount staked or risked was merely nominal none in the game being gamblers, the playing was for the amusement and but little was thought was or entertained of the amount bet.

That since the fine and before the fine He Has had all destroyed by the Armies and roving bands of plunders and to be compeled to pay the fine small as it, would be greatly oppressive at this time -- He would therefore most respectfully ask that the same be Remitted.
That if your Excellency is unwilling to remit. He asks that same be respited until He is more able to pay with out detriment to His family
Sworn to before me by said Duncan this 29th of March 1865
The undersigned Citizens of Kentucky and who are acquainted with the Petitioner W. H. Duncan believe His statements are true -- and asks the Gov. to remit the fine

David Y. Lyttle
Alex Levin
Christopher Hamm
R. Herndon
H. H. Hunter
James Sparks
B M. Landrum
John Smith
R. Boyd
J. W. Davis
Thomas Gining
Calvin Brogan
W. H. Randall
H. L. Tyler
At the time the Judgment was rendered I was Commonwealth Atty. The facst are as stated in the Indict Petition
I concur with Mr Dishman and hope that the fine will be remited

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
W. H. Duncan
